title: [BUG] - Server Keeps crashing randomly
body:
Redis replica in a simple Master-Slave Configuration keeps crashing randomly.
Ubuntu 22.04 LTS

=== REDIS BUG REPORT START: Cut & paste starting from here ===
32214:S 15 Apr 2024 15:08:17.765 # ------------------------------------------------
32214:S 15 Apr 2024 15:08:17.765 # !!! Software Failure. Press left mouse button to continue
32214:S 15 Apr 2024 15:08:17.765 # Guru Meditation: Replica was unable to write command to disk. #server.c:4029

------ STACK TRACE ------

Backtrace:

comments_data.body:
you might gotta check why rdb saving and aof rewrite are failing,
if we don't let it panic, it could lead to inconsistencies between master and replication.
btw, if you realy wanna ignore this panic, you can disable config `replica-ignore-disk-write-errors`, 
```
rdb_last_bgsave_status:err
aof_last_bgrewrite_status:err
```

@more456 Redis documentation says it only support until ubuntu 20.04. You are on ubuntu 22.04

https://redis.io/docs/latest/operate/rs/references/supported-platforms/

@gopivalleru no, this document is for Redis enterprise.
we always make Redis support all the different versions of operation systems as much as possible.

> @gopivalleru no, this document is for Redis enterprise. we always make Redis support all the different versions of operation systems as much as possible.

@sundb Is there similar documentation available for the community version of Redis that outlines the supported OS? If not what are the general guidelines?

@gopivalleru the document is in https://github.com/redis/redis#building-redis
```
Redis can be compiled and used on Linux, OSX, OpenBSD, NetBSD, FreeBSD. We support big endian and little endian architectures, and both 32 bit and 64 bit systems.

It may compile on Solaris derived systems (for instance SmartOS) but our support for this platform is best effort and Redis is not guaranteed to work as well as in Linux, OSX, and *BSD.
```

> @gopivalleru the document is in https://github.com/redis/redis#building-redis
> 
> ```
> Redis can be compiled and used on Linux, OSX, OpenBSD, NetBSD, FreeBSD. We support big endian and little endian architectures, and both 32 bit and 64 bit systems.
> 
> It may compile on Solaris derived systems (for instance SmartOS) but our support for this platform is best effort and Redis is not guaranteed to work as well as in Linux, OSX, and *BSD.
> ```

@sundb So, if I download and compile the Redis source code, I can use Ubuntu 24.04 in production , correct?

> > @gopivalleru the document is in [redis/redis#building-redis](https://github.com/redis/redis#building-redis)
> > ```
